headline: Bargain Income Powerhouses: These 2 Dividend Kings Could Deliver Massive Gains
summary: Dividend Kings are companies that have increased their dividends for at least 50 consecutive years, demonstrating resilience through economic cycles. Investors often start their stock searches among these names, especially when the market discounts them, as they offer reliable income streams and potential for capital appreciation during recoveries. In 2026, a number of these dividend ... Bargain Income Powerhouses: These 2 Dividend Kings Could Deliver Massive Gains

headline: S&P Dow Jones Indices and Lincoln International Unveil New Benchmarks for the Private Loan Market with Launch of S&P Lincoln Senior Debt Indices
summary: S&P Dow Jones Indices ("S&P DJI"), the world's leading index provider, in collaboration with Lincoln International, a global investment banking advisory firm, today announced the launch of the first two indices in the S&P Lincoln Senior Debt Index Series, to provide key benchmarking tools for measuring changes in the private loan market.

headline: Lumen Ratings Upgraded by Top 3 Global Ratings Agencies
summary: DENVER, February 23, 2026--Lumen Technologies (NYSE: LUMN) today announced that it has received upgraded ratings from all three major global ratings agencies – Fitch Ratings (Fitch), Moody’s Investor Service (Moody’s), and S&P Global (S&P) – marking a significant milestone in the company’s multi-year financial and operational transformation.

headline: 2 of Wall Street’s Favorite Stocks Worth Investigating and 1 That Underwhelm
summary: Wall Street has set ambitious price targets for the stocks in this article. While this suggests attractive upside potential, it’s important to remain skeptical because analysts face institutional pressures that can sometimes lead to overly optimistic forecasts.

headline: 3 Big Reasons SPGI Should Be On Your Watchlist
summary: S&P Global’s stock price has taken a beating over the past six months, shedding 24.4% of its value and falling to $417 per share. This was partly due to its softer quarterly results and might have investors contemplating their next move.
